meanings.definition: Unable to be avoided or escaped.
meanings.sent1: The ineludible truth is that the sun sets in the west every evening.
meanings.sent2: The consequences of his actions were ineludible, no matter how hard he tried to avoid them.
meanings.sent3: It was quite ineludible that the mischievous puppy would find its way into the mud puddle.
meanings.sent4: The ineludible reality of aging is that time stops for no one.
meanings.sent5: The ineludible storm clouds gathered ominously on the horizon.

meanings.sent1: The ineludible fact is that winter always follows autumn.
meanings.sent2: The ineludible truth of the matter is that hard work pays off in the end.
meanings.sent3: The ineludible charm of the old bookstore drew in customers from far and wide.
meanings.sent4: The ineludible grip of fear held her in its icy embrace.
meanings.sent5: The ineludible beauty of the sunset painted the sky in hues of pink and gold.
